summary: Website for Nepali users to ask questions in Nepali with voice (speech-to-text + text-to-speech), where each user can only see their own questions/answers using Internet Identity login.
architectural_notes: Use Internet Identity for authentication; scope stored questions/answers to the authenticated user (private-by-default data model).

existing_features.title: Update the frontend “Chat” experience to a private “My Q&A” page that only works when signed in with Internet Identity, showing the user’s own questions and answers and appropriate empty/loading/error states.
Add in-browser speech-to-text for Nepali input on the Q&A composer so users can dictate a question and have it populate the text input.
Add in-browser text-to-speech playback controls so users can listen to their question and/or answer read aloud.
Update user-facing labels and branding from generic “Chat” to a Nepali-focused private Q&A experience, while keeping all user-facing text in English.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a Nepali-language Q&A website with voice support (speech-to-text input and text-to-speech playback).
Implement per-user privacy: each user can only view their own questions and answers.
Add Internet Identity authentication to separate and secure each user's private Q&A data.

Implement per-user private storage and retrieval so that each authenticated user can only create and view their own Q&A items; no user should be able to read any other user's items, even if they know IDs or pagination parameters.

Replace the global chat message model with a private Q&A model that supports: creating a question, listing the caller’s questions, and saving an optional answer for a question (answer authored/edited by the same caller).
